content.description: Sit match start on great horizontal rail. Avoid using low shelf for feet to the right if possible but not necessary. Throw to high shelf and work your way left around the arete and then top out. The first few moves are relatively easy (V0-1) until you start moving left on the arete on a seemingly blank face. Top out is on the LEFT side of the arete for V4.
content.protection: 1-2 pads and spotter. Large rocks on landing.
content.location: This route is on the overhung north face of Pig Platter.

content.description: Start matched on same horizontal rail as Pork Dinner. Throw for shelf. Roll feet onto low shelf on the right. Once in standing position on low shelf. Top out on boulder by continuing onto second shelf and continuing up.
Start matched on same horizontal rail as "Pork Dinner". Throw to shelf above start and mantle out. Top out on top of boulder on right side of arete.
See photo below for reference. Once parked at Juji Fruit pullout parking. Walk north on Mt Scott Rd. Count 6 wooden railing posts. Stop and look NNW and you can see Pig Platter boulder.
